Package com.example.usersapi.controller

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.usersapi.controller.UserController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api/users")
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    The UserController class handles HTTP requests related to User resources. It provides endpoints for registering a new user and retrieving user details by ID. This class is responsible for processing incoming requests and invoking the appropriate methods in the UserService to perform the requested actions.
    See Also:
    UserService

    • Method Detail

      • registerUser

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> registerUser​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                  @Valid User user)
        POST endpoint for registering a new user.
        Parameters:
        user - The User object to be registered.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the registered User object and HTTP status code 201 (CREATED).
        Throws:
        DuplicateUsernameException - If the username already exists.
        InvalidUserException - If the user is not a French adult.
        See Also:
        User, UserService.registerUser(User)

      • getUserById

        @GetMapping("/{userId}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> getUserById​(@Valid @PathVariable
                                                                 @Valid java.lang.Long userId)
        GET endpoint for retrieving user details by ID.
        Parameters:
        userId - The ID of the user to retrieve.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the retrieved User object and HTTP status code 200 (OK).
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - If the user is not found.
        See Also:
        User, UserService.getUserById(Long)
